schedule: Nome – Moses Point – Nulato – Galena – Fairbanks
circumstances:
Shortly after take off from Nome Airport in poor weather conditions (snow falls), the single engine aircraft hit trees and crashed on a mountain slope. All six occupants were killed, among them a crew of three. 
Crew:
Robert Leslie Bullis, 
Fred Moller,
Mr. Theodore.
probable_cause: The probably cause of this accident was failure of the pilot to recognize his proximity to the ground due to heavy snow which entirely covered the terrain.
